title: Philip Hammond is completely wrong. Staying in the customs union would be an economic straitjacket
text:
Brexit isn’t Brexit without an independent trade policy

Philip Hammond’s alternative Brexit plan is another variation on ‘Common Market 2.0’, and just as unappealing. Under this plan the UK would have to follow the bulk of EU rules and regulations, with even less say in making them than we have today. The UK would also remain tied to the EU’s customs union, effectively abandoning the opportunity of forging an independent trade policy with the rest of the world. In other words, this would be Brexit ‘in name only’.
